required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Changes in Serum Vitamin D Level After Different Loading Doses of Cholecalciferol
clinical_study.official_title: Changes in Serum Vitamin D Level and Clinical Parameters After Different Loading Doses of Cholecalciferol (D3) in Young Adults With Vitamin D Deficiency

lead_sponsor.agency: Bangabandhu Sheikh Mujib Medical University, Dhaka, Bangladesh

clinical_study.source: Bangabandhu Sheikh Mujib Medical University, Dhaka, Bangladesh

brief_summary.textblock: it is a clinical trial to observe increase in serum vitamin D level and clinical symptoms after 3 different doses of cholecalciferol given either intramuscularly or oral.

detailed_description.textblock: A prospective, interventional study was conducted in Department of Rheumatology, BSMMU, Dhaka, Bangladesh from October 2015 to January 2017. One hundred and five clinically healthy adults of age 21-39 with serum vitamin D concentration were enrolled in the study. Serum vitamin D level was estimated by chemiluminescent micro particle immunoassay method at baseline and 3 months after the intervention. The participants were divided into three groups using random number table. Group A was given 6 lakh IU of cholecalciferol IM stat dose, group B was given 6 lakh IU of cholecalciferol orally with a glass of milk stat dose and group c was given 2 lakh IU of cholecalciferol orally once a month for 2 months followed by tablet cholecalciferol 1000 IU daily.

study_design_info.intervention_model_description: single center, interventional, open labelled study

primary_outcome.description: serum vitamin D level in ng/ml measured by CLIA method

secondary_outcome.description: visual analog scale of fatigue during last 7 days of interview measured in 10 cm scale
visual analog scale of generalized weakness during last 7 days of interview measured in 10 cm scale
visual analog scale of bone pain during last 7 days of interview measured in 10 cm scale
visual analog scale of muscle cramps during last 7 days of interview measured in 10 cm scale
visual analog scale of pain in weight bearing joints during last 7 days of interview measured in 10 cm scale
visual analog scale of difficulty in climbing stairs during last 7 days of interview measured in 10 cm scale

secondary_outcome.measure: difficulty in standing from squatting position
secondary_outcome.description: visual analog scale of difficulty in standing from squatting position during last 7 days of interview measured in 10 cm scale

arm_group.description: cholecalciferol 400,000 IU given orally in 2 divided doses given monthly for 2 consecutive months followed by daily maintenance dose of 1000 IU

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- hypovitaminosis D (serum 25 OH D < 20 ng/ml)
Exclusion Criteria:
- Chronic disease causing Vitamin D deficiency like CKD, nephrotic syndrome, liver disease, hyperparathyroidism, history of skin graft, malabsorption, hyperthyroidism, drugs like anticonvulsants, glucocorticoids, HAART Current pregnancy Lactose intolerance Previously treated with bolus Vitamin D supplementation within previous three months

responsible_party.investigator_affiliation: Bangabandhu Sheikh Mujib Medical University, Dhaka, Bangladesh
